page.title: 15PLACE NAMES OF OUR AREA
page.content: {Barrows Green}- Barray or Barrow was a former local family. "Green" derives from the O.E. word "grene"(grassy spot or village green). {Birkrigg}is formed by the O.N. "birki" (a birch tree) and "hryggr"(a ridged hill). {Crosscrake}is an inversion of the M.E. "cros"(a cross) and O.N. personal name, Kraki. {Holmescales}means the shielings (O.WScand. "skali") of Holme, a township to which it once belonged. {Shyreakes,}the name of a group of houses and a lane, comes from the O.E. words "scir"(bright) and "ac"(oak). Only two trees survive. {Stainton}means "the stone farmstead". The two parts are the O.E. "stan" or O.N. "steinn"(stone) and the O.E. "tun"(farmstead).
